__TOC__

This page holds contact information on the various <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/InternetRelayChat|IRC]]</nowiki> bots running in <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/InternetRelayChat#Channels|Ubuntu IRC channels]]</nowiki>. Please add your bot to this list.

=== Ubuntulog Terms ===

Ubuntulog can be joined to a non loco channel to provide official Ubuntu logging, which will appear on <nowiki>[[http://irclogs.ubuntu.com|Ubuntu's official irclogs page]]</nowiki>. If Ubuntulog is joined to your channel, you must add the following on-join message via chanserv: 
''Welcome to <#channel>. This channel is logged. Use of this channel implies acceptance of terms at https://wiki.ubuntu.com/IRC/TermsOfService''

The owner of the channel can add the message with the following command:
   
'''''/msg ChanServ SET #support ENTRYMSG Welcome to <#channel>. This channel is logged. Use of this channel implies acceptance of terms at https://wiki.ubuntu.com/IRC/TermsOfService'''''

(remember to inser the name of your channel in the <#channel> part

=== Info Bot Channels ===
There are different bots for different channels. If you need a bot in your ubuntu or related channel, you can ask from the bot maintainers in #ubuntu-bots-team.

The current policy for which bot goes to which channel is as follows: 

* <nowiki>[[#line-16|ubottu]]</nowiki> -> <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/IRC/IrcTeam/Scope|Core channels]]</nowiki> (+ a few selected extras)
* <nowiki>[[#line-23|ubot2]]</nowiki> -> <nowiki>[[Teams|Team]]</nowiki> channels A-L
* <nowiki>[[#line-24|ubot4]]</nowiki> -> <nowiki>[[Teams|Team]]</nowiki> channels M-Z
* <nowiki>[[#line-42|lubotu1]]</nowiki> -> <nowiki>[[Membership-RegionalBoards-Americas|Americas]]</nowiki> LoCo channels
* <nowiki>[[#line-43|lubotu2]]</nowiki> -> <nowiki>[[Membership-RegionalBoards-AsiaOceania|Asia]]</nowiki> LoCo channels
* <nowiki>[[#line-44|lubotu3]]</nowiki> -> <nowiki>[[Membership-RegionalBoards-EMEA|EMEA]]</nowiki> LoCo channels

=== External Bots ===

The <nowiki>[[IRC-IrcCouncil|IRC Council]]</nowiki> may also grant external public log bots to log certain channels, on the following conditions:
* Channel has 'ubuntuirccouncil' as contact with chanserv.
* Channel is already logged at irclogs.ubuntu.com by 'ubuntulog'.
* The bot satisfies all freenode rules and guidelines, is not anonymized and is easily identifiable by nickname.
Please make sure you contact the <nowiki>[[IRC-IrcCouncil|IRC Council]]</nowiki> before your bot joins freenode.
